properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 18 at 10:02AM EST until January 18 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Binghamton NY
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snow and some mixed precipitation expected. Total snow
accumulations of 2 to 4 inches and ice accumulations of a
light glaze expected. Southeast winds gusting as high as 35
mph will create areas of blowing and drifting snow.

* WHERE...In Pennsylvania, Bradford county. In New York,
Chemung, Schuyler, Steuben and Yates counties.

* WHEN...Steady snow quickly develops late this morning and
continues through the afternoon hours. Some sleet could mix in
during the late afternoon. The snow tapers off to snow showers,
light sleet and patchy freezing drizzle this evening.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates could briefly be around 1
inch per hour this afternoon. Temperatures will be in the upper
10s to 20s on today, rising into the lower 30s by late evening.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania
Turnpike Commission remind motorist to adjust speeds based on
driving conditions as winter weather impacts Pennsylvania
roadways. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadways,
and traffic conditions.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EST THIS EVENING
